Reviews.Title: “So good for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: If this is a 2 star hotel then I'd like to stay in a 3 star hotel in Venice. Service = great Location is really good too! Close to nice pizzeria's and restaurants. Eerything in Venice is within walking distance anyway (unless your lazy) Breakfast is fairly average but most places in Italy give the exact same breakfast from our experience. (hope you like bread) Beds are comfortable, rooms are clean and hot shower. All you could ask for. I would recommend this hotel definitely! Great value for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Anu J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I truly recommend Hotel Falier to any traveller who enjoys a quiet, peaceful stay at a good location. Personnel was very polite, helpful and friendly, rooms were superclean and comfortable. Rooms were quite small, but nice. And who wants to spend time in a hotel room when in Venice anyway:)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: mokky
Reviews.Content: It is easy to find and well maintained. The set up is warm and cosy. There is also free Wi-fi. The breakfast is nothing to shout about. However, the staff are friendly and helpful. It has a 3-star feel to a 2-star establishment. I must say it is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Kingpete
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in a nearby hotel the previous year which wasn't all it was cracked up to be but this was better - glorious location in my favourite part of Venice, traditional, comfortable, clean and welcoming, and not pretending to be anything it isn't. By Venice standards, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Best 21st Birthday Present”
Reviews.Author: AMEDerry
Reviews.Content: We got a room on the top floor, our own veranda and beautifially decorated, wooden beams and nice breakfast. The location was central and I would return to this hotel as it was a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary, but OK”
Reviews.Author: Ullert
Reviews.Content: After all, this is Venice and a hotel room does not come for free. Stayed 1 night and for that length the hotel was OK. The room was small and a bit smelly (of damp/mould). Chose hotel due to proximity to car parking facilities. + for breakfast incl. and free use of Wifi. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Was above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sc0ttish_c0uple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights last week and had a good sized room and bathroom on the second floor at the far end of the corridor. Looking at the fire escape plan, our bedroom looked the largest on the floor but the others looked a good enough size for sleeping and our belongings as most of our time was spent sightseeing etc. The room was very nice and clean and our bathroom had views over the gardens to the left of the hotel. We were very happy with the service received from the different receptionists as well as the other staff who were helpful when required. The location of the hotel is great as it is not directly on the Grand Canal which can be noisy and it is only a few minutes walk from the Bus station where we were dropped off by the airport bus. There are also many restaurants near by and all the attractions within Venice are easy to walk to. We would definitely stay here again and recommend booking directly with the hotel as a cheaper rate will be given compared to other accommodation websites.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job, just could do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Mini026
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights from a saturday to Wednesday. We knew from reviews the rooms would be small - our tiny bathroom had a shower over the toilet with a curtain to isolate a tiny space for showering and I'm quite slim. On second day we had been eating breakfast for 5 or so minutes when the power went off. The waiter didn't seem surprised and opened the curtains to let the light in. So far we hadn't been approached for hot drinks and it was the first opportunity we had to ask - he said there was no power so couldn't make hot drinks then shrugged. He said the power was off from 9pm to 12 noon, as if it was a planned shutdown. The attitude and lack of dedication to serving hot drinks to those who appeared for breakfast meant that we went without one - he had 5 minutes to offer and serve us one if he knew it was going off. Additionally i was unable to dry my hair when we got back to the room - a good way for a hotel to save on the power bill! No apologies or compensation was made at reception. Otherwise the hotel served its function, was tidy and clean. However within a minutes walk there are places that are smarter or simply more modern (e.g. separate shower).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puppiespaws
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this hotel. Its in the heart of Venice surrounded by the lovely canals and shopping with a short stroll to the markets and restaurants. This hotel is in the perfect location and if its a traditional Venice experience you are looking for then this hotel is it. I highly recommend staying here, if you are tossing up whether to stay here or head over to Lido (the other island of Venice) then DONT BOTHER with Lido, we covered Lido in an hour and there is nothing there, where this hotel is located is IDEAL!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TwoPotScreamer
Reviews.Content: For a two star hotel in Venice the room and rate were reasonable. We had a double room on the 2nd floor which was very small, minimal room around the bed and compact bathroom. It was clean and quiet. There were two windows to allow natural light in the room as well. Breakfast was limited with only juice, milk, cereal, croissants, yogurt and coffee. A short walk (10 to 15 mins) to the train station however it's about 30 mins' walk to the St Mark's Square. Although we didn't mind the walk as there were plenty of shops, canals, bridges to see. Free WiFi was handy. Hotel staff was helpful. No English language TV. No lift. Overall if you travel on budget it's not too bad as a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Us”
Reviews.Author: Angie H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Falier. The room was great. It was small but we expected that. We didnâ€™t expect the private veranda that we had on the 4th floor â€“ a very pleasant surprise. The room were very clean and the staff was so helpful. We will recommend this hotel to anyone and would come again if we ever get back to Venice. I started from scratch on the internet looking for a place â€“ had no idea what I was looking for except a good price, air-con, internet and good coffee and I found this hotel somehow. It was the perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Our second time here. We will definitely return. Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: philosopher43
Reviews.Content: Our group consisted of my granddaughter (18 years of age) and my spouse and me. My spouse and I stayed here eight years earlier and we enjoyed the Hotel Falier then and decided to return. A wise choice! Although the rooms are small (We had 1 double and 1 single room) they are well kept and clean. The location is excellent--away from the bustle (and prices) near St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge yet within easy access by foot or vaporetto to the entire town. The staff was very helpful with advice and directions. The hotel includes a nice, quiet courtyard in which we had wine and cheese every evening before venturing out for the night's activities. (Items purchased at a nearby grocers.) the morning breakfast is ample and the service is excellent. Within easy walking distance of the train station--10 minute jaunt but there are steps and bridges over the canals. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It stinks and it's not very clean!”
Reviews.Author: jeffveilleux
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good place in Venise. That's the only good point. The room stinks, the air conditionning is not able to furnish the room. The wall under the air conditioning is full moisture (funghi). The clealiness is not good. So, i recommend to everyone not to stay there. We reserved for 2 days and we stayed 1 days because it's dirty and it stinks. Finally, we feel all the spring in the matress.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: 1965ann
Reviews.Content: I would unreservedly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a quiet, comfortable, well-appointed, impeccably clean, reasonably priced 2 star hotel offering a very adequate breakfast. It is an easy walk from Piazzale Roma where the bus from Marco Polo terminates and within reasonable walking distance to many places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Shameelah
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms though on small side, close to piazza Roma and san marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Piazzale Roma, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Ali255093
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good location and complimentary internet which was very helpful. However the rooms and bathrooms were very small, but I think this is common in Venice. The bed was comfortable and we were pleased that they turned the air con on that day as it was very hot while we were in Venice. The breakfast was good. Overall the hotel was reasonable and not too badly priced for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: edenpac
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great service. Location was good and easy to get to from the garage. Room was small, but clean. The service was very good and the staff very nice. Simple online booking in last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, clean, quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Worthingwanderers
Reviews.Content: This very reasonably priced hotel was a real find. We've stayed in Venice several times, but this was probably the best 'budget' priced hotel we've stayed in. Though our room was small, it had many of the facilities you'd expect of a 3-star, rather than 2-star hotel: a small, but perfectly adequate shower room with basic toiletries, comfortable double bed, safe and generous continental breakfast. It was spotlessly clean and very quiet: we slept soundly every night. Staff were polite and helpful. Walls were lined with padded, damask material which really helped with soundproofing. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fair hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOVXVOM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Falier and we think the price was fair: the room was clean and silent, nice staff, good free internet connection and online booking. Everything worked properly in our room, no leaks or things like that. No musty smell although itâ€™s an old building. We thought the breakfast was just OK, but I think itâ€™s a problem with breakfasts in Italy in general. Moreover, it's close to everything, if you don't get lost in Venice, of course! It was our first time in Venice and, as we loved the city, weâ€™ll get back for a longer stay and surely weâ€™ll be at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably Good”
Reviews.Author: FionaHoran
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice several times, and booked Hotel Falier because I had stayed there more than ten years ago, and remember it being a good hotel. This time, the room prices were an absolute bargain for Venice. The hotel is in a good position, reasonably close to the bus and train stations, and on a pleasant street. I notice that some people have complained that the rooms are small. In my experience, all Venetian hotels within my budget have small hotel rooms! I didn't find my room too small. There was a desk, chair, wardrobe, and shelving as well as the bed and en suite bathroom. Our rooms were on the second floor, by the way. One of the en suite bathrooms had a shower inside a cubicle, the other had the slightly annoying shower-in-a-corner affair that can potentially drench the rest of the bathroom. The weather was pretty bad - cold and wet - so we were grateful that the hotel was well heated. The free wifi was a definite bonus. You just have to ask the staff at the desk for a password. The staff were friendly and polite. Continental breakfasts are never the highlight of any European holiday - but it was better than many I've had - rolls, brioches, yoghurts, fruit juices, cornflakes, cheese, etc. You can book this hotel with confidence, and the booking via the website was very straightforward. I was very pleased that I had chosen it again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the heart of venice.”
Reviews.Author: adelenicola
Reviews.Content: If you are seeking an independent, small hotel with a friendly team look no furthur then Hotel Falier. I have just returned from a 5 day break in venice and my mum and I stayed at Hotel Falier. The location is wonderful, located off a small canal very near piazza roma bus terminus. The setting is beautiful with many small restaurants and cafes located near the hotel. The rooms are small but charming, decorated in typical italian style. Breakfast is basic served in the small dining room with very attentive staff. There are 3 small terraces which we would have loved to enjoy a latte on however it was too cold for us in oct! Maybe next time in the summer. If you are wanting a small family run hotel in a good location with great service I would certainly recommend hotel falier.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Falier is a little gem”
Reviews.Author: Mike186356
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal for seeing Venice, and the hotel is very affordable in an otherwise expensive city. The staff are friendly and helpful, and our room was clean, comfortable, and regularly serviced. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirja
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a nice little street from where you can easily expore Venice. Everything is withing a walking distance through the nice little streets of the city. The service was very good and the staff very nice. Always helpful when you need information. All in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: xnavylee
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with great service. Location was good and easy to get to from the bus pick-up/drop-off area as well as train station. Rooms where small but that's pretty much normal for Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Night staff rude”
Reviews.Author: jeani
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful,close to connections for train and bus. The day staff were always helpful. The younger night staff "kid" was smiling and answered questions even adding info to be more exact in answering. The older night staff was rude,unhelpful and made sure you knew you were a bother to his TV watching,sleeping...it made for some uncomfortable moments with his audible sighs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TNJoe
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Falier. We found the hotel staff to be very nice, in particular the gentleman at the desk, do not know his name, but was dressed in suit and wearing red rimmed glasses, was very friendly. We stayed in room #11 for one night. The room was nice except that the bed was too large for the room and the bed was uncomfortable. The hotel was very clean; we enjoyed the outside terrace and set out there for a while and drank wine and ate cheese. Very convenient to the Piazzale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel, tiny rooms but a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Suebee068
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay and walked miles. Loved the district we were in, lots of shops and businesses but also a great mixture of historical sights and local homes. Hotel is very clean and has great character, though the rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice - Klein aber fein”
Reviews.Author: affrofant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very small with only around 20 rooms. Our room was very small, too. But as we stayed only for 1 night, it was def. enough. The furnishing was old-styled (with fabric wallpaper) but nice! The concierges were all very polite and helpful, the breakfast was good enough to start into the day. From Piazzale Roma it's about 10min walk over two bridges, to the famous Piazza San Marco it's app. 30min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: zia30
Reviews.Content: hotel was easy to find and located at 5 minutes to piazzale roma where we can take any taxi bus to visit around. at 5 minuted from the railway station and nice little shops on the way to the hotel at cheaper prices. breakfast is basic. rooms are cosy. if you only need a place to sleep this is the place to go. clean bathroom. free internet which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: boxleyBristol Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, helpful and polite. Room v clean and comfy. Quiet location but near enough to everything - just loved the prosecco bars. Good restaurant across the road doing proper food. beware the tourist menus in some places and ask for wine by the carafe - good quality and much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Good location”
Reviews.Author: SeanSeanSeanSean
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£60 a night for a double, and you dont get much for that in Venice! Falier was spot on though, good location for price (within 15-20 min walk of St Marks Square - which is the furthest sight), clean rooms, and sufficient breakfast (toasts, jam, cereals, cold meat, fruit juices, tea etc.) included. Only downside was the size of the room, less than a meter either side and end of the double bed! Would have been annoying, but for Â£60 a night we figured in Venice you wont get much better.

Reviews.Title: “The handy falier”
Reviews.Author: ParkViewScotland
Reviews.Content: Not a luxurious hotel but a friendly hotel . Not a 5star hotel but a 2star, HOWEVER the falier was in the ideal spot for transport. The train, and the bus stations, were only a couple of hundred yards away, if that ! It was quiet and friendly and offered help when required. The hotel was spotless as were the rooms and it didn't cost a fortune as it could have done. (especially a Regatta time ) The regatta was viewed from nearby and was magic. Also met count Francesco da Mosto around the corner to make the day. Excellent value at the Falier, probably a little heard of hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jodypops1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it. Room was unbelieveably clean! Spotless! that made up for the fact the room was a bit on the small side but i have stayed in smaller. Air conditioning was very good too, stayed on all night.. Modern room. Only drawback was the breakfast, not much choice and all the croissants had apricot jam inside yuk.. All in all tho, definitely worth the money and would definitely come back! oh and there was free internet access at reception (bonus). Only a 10 minute walk to the hotel from railway station and very easy to find (which is a big plus in Venice as it's easy to get lost!!)

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AliTVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights while we visited Venice. The woman who initially checked us in was pleasant and helpful, but the staff that were on the rest of the time during our visit were completely the opposite. They were so unfriendly and snobby that it was actually funny. There was one morning where I handed in the key to our room before going out sightseeing and the man at the desk wouldn't even look at me to acknowledge that I had given it to him. It was strange. The rooms were fine, although beginning to look a bit run down. They were decorated in a Venetian style with antigue style furniture, fabric covered walls, and glass decorative fixtures. The room was comfortable, but small. It served our purpose well, since we were out sightseeing most of the time. The breakfasts were also pretty good, but basic.

Reviews.Title: “amazing little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: triwka
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during our trip to Venice this February. It was a very busy time as Venice Carnival was just about to start but we always felt welcomed in the hotel. Reception is very polite and considerate, breakfast quite nice - the lady even baked special fruit scones for the first day of the carnival which was a nice touch. Room was cosy and tidy. Windows overlooked a quiet walkway between two houses, however even on the first floor the view wasn't blocked by the adjacent house and we've got our portion of morning sunshine. They also offer a free one-way water taxi ride to Murano island, which we enjoyed quite a lot! Just be prepared to find your own way back from the island! Overall I've had a very nice experience in this hotel and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: Stoney510
Reviews.Content: I was scared to stay at this hotel after reading the review from NortonNorthWest below. I am very picky about my accommodations, but I found my experience at Hotel Falier to be EXCELLENT. The property is lovely, the staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was very clean. We loved the location of the hotel which is away from the tourist areas. I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: REDRUBY711
Reviews.Content: I selected Hotel Falier based on reviews and did not know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised to have stayed at this hidden gem. It is a small hotel about a seven to ten minute walk from Santa Lucia station. I suggest making your first stop at the tourist center. You can buy a tourist pack containing a map and guide book for 2.50 euros (a great deal). Upon meeting the hotel staff, they were very kind with a smile and a "Buon Giorno." The room was quaintly decorated in a Venetian design. It was small but a typical size for most European hotels (not a big deal to me). My daughter and I stayed for five days so there was ample closet and storage space for our lugagge and things. One thing I did appreciate was the cleanliness of the hotel and room. Our room was immaculate. The bathroom was modernized and an adequate size to accomodate the personal items of two women. Our stay included breakfast that was simple: a variety of croissants, rolls, biscuits; preserves; yogurts and; your choice of juice and coffees. Venice is a city for walking. The Hotel Falier is centrally located to most sites and within walking distance. For a change, you can also take the water taxi. We stayed on for several trips around the canal. Don't forget your camera because the view is picture perfect. Just beautiful! As for food, there area several restaurants and bars nearby just take your pick. I wanted to experience some of the local cuisine and had the cuttle fish with polenta. My daughter had the gorgonzola with walnuts and penne. Both were YUMMY!!! You can also save a few euros by shopping at the supermarket for basics (water, sodas, juice and munchies). You can also venture down one of the alleys to a bar, deli, bakery or the Rialto Market for fresh fruits and veggies. Some of our best meals were a bottle of wine, bread, variety of cheeses, salad and antipasti. The Hotel Falier only enhanced our stay Venice. For the value and ammenites the hotel offered, I would stay at Hotel Falier again and recommend it to a fellow traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaArt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here several years ago and found the hotel modest, as we expected for a 2 star hotel, but with a great location and a nice if basic upstairs room. At that time we considered it a great value for Venice. This year, however, our downstairs room was clean, but very cramped, and worst of all it smelled of sewer gas. The man who seemed to be the "night staff" was unhelpful and rude when I needed assistance with their method of internet log on. I had interrupted his watching television.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly enchanting.”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinenick
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and will definitely go back. I was attracted to it after reading the Guide Routard and Tripadvisor. On the website it looked pretty but of course most hotels look pretty on the websites. I made up my mind to book when I saw they had an internet offer: pay online (non refundable) and you get 20% discount. So in November (low season for most hotels in Venice), a twin ensuite room with breakfast cost me only 72euros per night. It's a small cozy hotel in the heart of Venice. I know the city well, but always inevitably get lost trying to find my way around. This hotel, on the contrary, was very easy to get to from the train station (5-6 minutes), so I strongly advise it for anybody who's never been to the city and/or has heavy luggage. The directions from station to hotel and viceversa are easily memorized - not a common thing in Venice. The hotel is small and elegantly furnished. The staff are very professional and polite. Big breakfast with a variety of hot and cold food/drink that can keep you going for hours. Part of it is buffet, but for coffee and extras you ask a waitress. The interior is spotless, carpeted and very quiet. So was my room, n. 26, at the end of the first floor corridor. I haven't seen any other room, but I have no reason to believe they are any way different from mine. I'm not sure how many floors there are (I think 2), nor if there is a lift, so if you find it hard to walk or have heavy luggage, ask before booking. My room was perfect. Spotless (I'm the sort of person who looks under beds and behind furniture), with quality beds, bed linen, windows and furnishings. The style is Venetian, with pastel coloured wood and delicate flower designs. The bathroom was also spotless, with clean towels every day, hairdryer, extractor fan, mosquito net at the window (some hotel bathrooms don't even have a window!), and accessories. Strong hot shower. The room featured TV, phone, a small safe, air conditioning, and extra snow white pillows. Everything was working perfectly. During my stay, the weather changed abruptly, with temperatures outside well below zero and freezing winds, but the room was nice and warm. Admittedly, my room was not very large (the Hilton certainly has bigger ones), but the size of hotel rooms is last in order of importance for me. This twin room has more than enough space for two people to move round, store and open cases, shoes, clothes and personal belongings, sit at the desk, look out of the window, etc. The bathroom was very spacious and also warm. A piece of advice: the hotel offers a free water-taxi ride to Murano. Take advantage of it, even if you've already pre-paid public transport! If, like me, you're not rolling in money and unable to spend 60 or more euro for the thrill of a taxi in Venice, you'll feel like royalty, sitting on leather sofas and enjoying the canals (including a part of the Canal Grande) from a totally different perspective, arriving at destination in no time. The reason why Falier and other hotels offer this trip is to encourage visitors to buy original Murano glass and not be lured into buying the cheap Chinese imports sold in the vast majority of shops all over Venice as "real Murano glass". This water-taxi will bring you to Murano, where you will go into a glass-making factory, see a short demonstration of the glass blowing process (very interesting), and then go on into a showroom where you can browse round, have assistance if you wish, and feel under no pressure whatsoever to buy. I, for example, didn't. If you think it's impossible that an inexpensive 2star hotel doesn't have anything "wrong with it", I can tell you that the only thing "wrong" with my room was the lid of the little bin in the bathroom, which wouldn't stay on its hinges. Not a major inconvenience! I have found my hotel in Venice and will come back here again and again. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Venice”
Reviews.Author: wendyelmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 4 days, and found the hotel great. It's in a quiet-ish area, which is great to come back to after a busy day's sightseeing, but at the same time is about 5-10 minutes walk from the Grand Canal and the vaporetto stop, and there were also a lot of good bars and restaurants in the area. Staff were friendly and helpful. On the last day our flight was not until the evening, and they looked after our bags for us (and also let us back to the room after we checked out and then realised we'd left the car keys behind.) The rooms are not huge, but not incredibly cramped either, and there is enough space. It tended to get a bit hot, but we mentioned at reception about the maid not shutting the window so that some air could circulate in the day, and they sorted that out. Breakfast is perfectly satisfactory: a buffet of cereal, rolls, french toast, yogurt and croissants, with a selection of tea or coffee and the usual condiments. All in all, we found it a good base for our holiday, and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Yeah the rooms are small-ish, but I still liked it”
Reviews.Author: nysingle
Reviews.Content: I liked the Falier. I would go back again. The hotel was well priced for Venice (<100 e/night). I didn't think the rooms were that small, I was very comfy in a single. It was clean, well furnished, and pretty. I liked the front desk people very much. They reminded me of the helpful guy from Under the Tuscan Sun. The breakfast was basic Italian (pastries, yogurt, etc) but decent. The WiFi worked well and was free. There's also a computer for free use in the lobby. The hotel is only a 10-15 minute from the bus or train station. It's away from the tourist sights, which is a plus or minus depending on your point of view. It was good because it was quiet. It was bad because it was a pain to find your way back at times (it is very easy to get totally lost in Venice, one block off and you're toast!). Anyway, I thought I got a good deal, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Intelins
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a very tiny room in the Falier. You could barely move. The room cost 120euro, one of the most expensive rooms I ever stayed in. (In defense: i booked really last minute 1 day before going there) The breakfast is truly Italian: everybody lacks of taste. In the end Venice itself makes you forget that your Hotel is rather mediocre. However it is really close to the Gran Canal you can get there within minutes and also close to the busstation and the Chiesa dei Frari Church. San Pantalon, the "street" where it lies is very beautiful with little bridges over the water just close by.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK....”
Reviews.Author: BeetleBumbee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Falier for 2 nights in September 2008. The hotel falier is about a 10-15 minute walk from the Venice train station. The room was ready when we got there, and we were promptly shown our room. The room was fairly small and basic. Nothing really to rave about. The shower in the bathroom was a tight fit. In my opinion, Venice is very expensive. And really...the hotel is not worth the price that they are asking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: salas53
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice and we decided to stay away from the crowded tourist areas. The Hotel Falier was an excellent choice. We booked five nights and could not have been more pleased. Great location (less than a ten-minute walk from the train station), very clean room, friendly and helpful staff, and reasonably priced for Venice. They offer up a great continental breakfast, the restroom was surprisingly more spacious than we had expected, and the neighborhood was especially quite. We would recommend a stay here to anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: croletter
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise we found in the Hotel Falier. We stayed for 4 nights in early June 2008 and had zero complaints. The hotel is in a great location, convenient to the Bus and Train stations, and is off the beaten path. It was nice to be in a neighborhood setting and still be a 15 minute stroll to St. Marks Square. The hotel itself is very clean and charming. It is not a 5 star hotel, and it doesn't need or pretend to be. The rooms are on the small side, but this is typical with most hotel rooms in Venice. We stayed in Room #33 the first night (which was a standard room), and since we had called a few weeks ahead and asked for the terrace room (#41), they were kind enough to move us there for the next three nights - and what a great room that is! It has it's own private terrace, and the room felt a little bigger...the shower is smaller and water collects right on the floor next to the toilet, but no big deal...the terrace was awesome!!! We sat out there most nights before dinner and enjoyed the great views and bells from the nearby church towers. (They even throw in free wireless internet service). Breakfast was adequate with bread, coffee, juice, cereal (no hot food). There are plenty of nearby restaurants worth trying as well - we recommend "Al Ponte", about a 10 minute walk from the hotel, right on a small canal - great food and ambiance. All in all we were very happy with the Falier and the hotel employees - especially Massimo, who took great care of us. They all speak fluent English as well. This was a great deal for a small hotel...great place to be for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Falier - We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Smiley-Caz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I wasn't disappointed. We arrived by bus from the airport and once off the bus at the Piazza Roma found the hotel with in minutes following the directions provided with the booking confirmation. The hotel is tucked away in one of the quieter districts but we found this suited us perfectly as we were able to walk and explore and discover the more tourist areas and fall up on them rather than be stuck right in the middle of all the hussle and the bussle. We also felt that we had a truer Venitian experience as the great bars and restaurants around the hotel were not the typical tourist traps that you find closer to the San Marco area. We thought the hotel it self was lovely. Very nicely decorated in true italian style. It was very clean and the rooms were tidied and beds changed daily. They were beautiful but quite small although I gather this is usual for hotel rooms in Venice. Our only slight grumble was the bed. It was like sleeping on an ironing board and with both my partner and I being quite tall our feet stuck out the end as they were quite small. But all the other positives about the hotel more than made up for this. The staff were helpful and friendly. I broke my travel plug whilst I was there and they were happy to lend me a replacement. They also gladly stored our luggage on the last day. A number of places I have been more recently charge for this! I would highly recommend this gorgeous, reasonably priced hotel in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bfernandez09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Falier is a great, reasonably-priced hotel in Venice. The location is perfect because it is less than a ten minute walk from the train station. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They recommended a tour to Murano, Burano and Torcello, which was wonderful and cheap. Our room was small with its own bathroom, but it was clean and quaint. The breakfast was good, too. There's also a great restaurant right next door. I would definitely recommend this hotel because it is very well-priced for the quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hide-Away”
Reviews.Author: jthoel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Falier is an adorable little hotel in a fantastic location. We took the bus from the airport and walked to the hotel from Piazza Roma (Bus Station in Venice) The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the consierge - he was available to us 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. Breakfast was standard with delicious coffee and cappuccino made to order. The room was small, but clean and quiet. The bathroom was large for European standards, and the water pressure was great! Nice flat screen TV in all the rooms. We arrived early in the day (10 AM) and were able to get right into our room. If you are looking for a clean hotel with a great location for an good price - this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dhmellor
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this place is its location - a short walk from the car park and bus station at Piazzale Roma, and from the railway station, and yet in a characterful location. The area is very atmospheric and Venetian, but away from the most touristy area near S Marco and the Rialto. The university is nearby, which gives it a lively studenty feel. The hotel itself is clean and tidy and very well run by friendly people. We have stayed three times over the years and will keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to come home to.”
Reviews.Author: tomasitoAustralia
Reviews.Content: I did alot of research on hotels before travelling to Venice - I had saved up for so long to get there and wanted to make sure that I had a nice place to stay. I was very pleased with this hotel and found the comments made by previous travellers spot on. I didn't go expecting a 4 star luxury hotel. The accomodation was modest, but clean, cosy and serviced daily. The bathroom was small, and did flood with every shower (as the floor was not recessed). The breakfast consisted of bread, crossaints, cereal, yoghurt, juice and coffee/tea. A lovely way to fuel up for a long day of walking. The hotel was a walk (10-15mins) to most main attractions, but all the shops and cafes along the way made the walk very enjoyable. Staff were very friendly and made us feel very welcome. Especially Maria, the breakfast waitress. Excellent value for the 50euro we paid per night (winter season).

Reviews.Title: “Book room number 41”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London
Reviews.Content: Venice is Venice - get a map before you go ! The shower was definitely designed for tall & thin people as it is enclosed in a shower curtain with an area the size of a handbasin, however water was strong & hot. Brekky is in a nice setting and what was there was delicious, however the variety is basic continental style. Room #41 is up a very narrow staircase, the only room on the top floor and has a private outdoor sundeck. No canal views here at all however there are views to closeby church spires & courtyards. Very private, very cosy, very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Bring thongs/slippers!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: snuffers
Reviews.Content: Paid about $105CDN a night via expedia. Free continental breakfast was great. Location was quite a walk away from the square, but good price for staying inside Venice. Bring thongs or slippers... the washroom shower wets the WHOLE washroom (toilet, floor, sink and all)!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Shirley_from_Paris
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Falier after just a ten minute walk from the train station along the beautiful Grand Canal, putting us right away in the Venitian spirit. The staff was very friendly and showed us to our immaculate, quiet and cozy room on the ground floor of the building. Our room did not have much light as opposed to those facing the front of the hotel, but we actually appreciated being on the cooler side of the building and kept the room in spite of the hotel's willingness to move us to a sunnier one (we arrived in the middle of a European heat wave!). And yes, there is good air conditioning in the rooms and lobby which made the hotel nice to come back to after a day of site-seeing under the sun. I didn't find the room or bathroom particularly small. The shower stall was smallish, but I have seen worse in Europe! Just across from the room was a door leading outside to a nice little garden set up with tables and ashtrays (Italy is now completely non-smoking indoors!). Just don't forge to bring an anti-mosiquito spray to apply to your skin for going out in the evening and another product for the room if you want to open your windows (I opted for a diffuser you can find at any supermarket there that you plug into an outlet that diffuses a cedar scent that keeps the mosquitos away) as Northern Italy and especially Venice is full of them in the summer; The location was great - just a 10 or 15 minute walk through the charming little side streets to the major sites such as San Marco or the Rialto. There are yellow signs on the buildings in Venice directing you to all the attractions and wandering around in them gives you a real taste of life in Venice! The location was close to the tourist attractions, but also quiet and somewhat residential which gave us a view of authentic Venitians going about their business and not just other tourists. Another plus was being close to a lot of authentic and affordable restaurants as opposed to some that are really bad and extremely expensive in the more touristy areas. Continental breakfast was also satisfying with as much made to order coffee, latte or cappucino as you want. The Hotel Falier is definitely a great find and well worth the mere 79 euros a night I spent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You will not mistake this hotel for a luxuious four-star in Venice. However, in this very expensive hotel market the Hotel Falier is a great value. My wife and I stayed two nights in Venice and loved it. The hotel was a great place to come back to after a full day of walking and seeing sights. Standard double bed in the room with TV, safe and hairdryer. The rooms are small (but everything is in Venice anyway). There is a great restaurant just down the way from the hotel (ask the front desk). Also check out the nearby Piazza Margherita. Cafe Blue is also a great pub nearby. Hotel pluses: rooms are clean and quiet, hotel staff is extremely nice and friendly (made some great restaurant recommendations), breakfast is nicely done, and the location is good (15 min. walk from St. Mark's, 10 min. from Ponte Rialto, 3 min. from closest vaperetto stop). Negative: bathrooms are very, very small. The good definitely outweights the bad in our opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: davidthevagabond
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Falier in early April. We enjoyed it very much and believe it is good value for the money. Easy walking distance from the Train Station,Piazzale Roma, and the Vaporetto, very quiet, private room in a quiet neighborhood with good, comfortable bed, helpful desk personnel and good breakfast buffet. We would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Falier
HotelInfo.Address: Salizzada San Pantalon 130, 30135 Venice, Italy
